name: Communicating in a World of Data
description: This course examines theory and offers practice in analyzing, interpreting, and communicating data in an understandable and engaging manner. The course explores the growing relevance and allure of Data in all its forms. Students will learn to interpret data to tell a story through numbers by creating infographics, writing informative articles from their own data mining, and presenting further findings at the end of the semester. The course draws on a range of theorists and data experts including Arvind Sathi, Kenneth Cukier, Viktor Mayer-Schonberger, and Eric Siegel. [24L]
